body: @neerajprad this is a nice beginner task if you'd like to work on it, but no hurry ðŸ˜„

Is this still being worked on? If not, I could give it a try. If Pyro's `BetaBinomial` were exposed, I could register a `Contraction` for `Beta` and `Binomial` over the Beta's value to produce a `BetaBinomial`. Then I'd register a `Binary` `SubOp` between the joint `Contraction[Beta,Binomial]` and `BetaBinomial` to produce the posterior `Beta`.
@bogiebro go ahead, I believe nether @neerajprad nor I are working on this at the moment.

I have Dirichlet -Multinomial conjugacy working, but Beta-Binomial is a little tricky. The eager interpretation of a Beta is just to convert it to a Dirichlet (in `eager_beta` from `funsor/distribution.py:357`). This means I can't dispatch on Betas to take advantage of conjugacy: they vanish! I tried assembling the Beta and Bernoulli in a lazy interpretation before reducing them in an eager interpretation. This couldn't get around the problem, unfortunately. A Contraction's arguments get reinterpreted under eager mode  when the Contraction is interpreted under eager mode, so once again the Betas  get converted to Dirichlets. Perhaps this doesn't matter- if we have Dirichlet-Multinomial conjugacy, and Betas and Binomials get converted to Dirichlets and Multinomials automatically anyway, then we get conjugacy for Betas and Binomials for free. 

Shall I make a pull request for the Dirichlet Multinomial conjugacy?

> Shall I make a pull request for the Dirichlet Multinomial conjugacy?

Sure, go ahead!

issue.title: Add Dirichlet Multinomial conjugacy
issue.body: As a first step towards issue #5, this exposes pyro's DirichletMultinomial distribution as a funsor, and defines two eager evaluation rules. The added tests show how to use this to find the posterior of a Dirichlet given observations from a Multinomial.

issue.title: Add patterns for conjugacy
issue.body:
Addresses https://github.com/pyro-ppl/numpyro/issues/756, https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/2620
Following up #5, https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/issues/1707

This proposes to add new patterns for conjugacy which can be used in Pyro's `poutine.collapse()`.

- [x] Categorical-Categorical
- [x] Gaussian-Gaussian
- [x] #385 Gamma-Gamma
- [x] #345 Dirichlet-multinomial
- [x] #345 Beta-binomial
- [x] Beta-Bernoulli
- [x] Dirichlet-Categorical
- [x] Gamma-Poisson
- [ ] inverse-chi2-normal (reduces to StudentT)
- [ ] plates e.g. Beta-plated(Bernoulli)
- [ ] transformed distributions e.g. LogNormal-LogNormal
- [others](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjugate_prior#Table_of_conjugate_distributions)?
